content.description: This is a great intro to a “McDowell 5.7”.  Meaning it’s probably a little stiffer than your average route of the same rating. Nevertheless it has fun movement, great balancy sequences and good bolt placement... past the first ankle breaker. Go get your slab on!
content.protection: 2 bolts and bolt anchors. The first bolt is about 18 feet up on moderate ground. This gives the route a.PG13 rating. using a clip stick would eliminate the risk and make this a very safe route.

content.description:
A very fun, tenuous face climb with small frictiony feet and smaller granite crystals for the hands. This route goes straight up the middle of the north side of the energizer boulder and then veers left about 2/3’s of the way. Finish the route by moving right back on to the route to the anchor.

 Can be Top Roped by climbing Energizer or Hawk
content.protection: Two bolts and anchors at the top. The first bolt is located about 20 feet off the ground and the terrain to get to that bolt is thin.  BEWARE! .  Fortunately you can lead “Hawk” on the south side of the boulder and set up a Top rope for Gripple.

content.description: Make a couple challenging moves to gain a great jug.  Once your on the jug is a fun, easier jaunt to the finish.
content.protection: 2 bolts and anchors at the top. The first bolt looks old and sketchy.
content.location: Follows the NE arete of energizer boulder.  Located climbers left of gripple.

content.description:
Located at the base of Sven Slab. Easy access to this fun and challenging 40 foot tall boulder. Note: this is referred to as “energizer boulder” in McDowell Rock by Erik Filsinger.

 NOTE: (11/16/2018). Thanks to the efforts and hard work of a few individuals, all the hardware on the Hawk boulder has been replaced and updated. Thank you to the ASCA for supplying the bolts!   Please consider donating to the ASCA to keep programs like this going!
